metadata.Title: CVE-2021-27921 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: Pillow before 8.1.1 allows attackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumption) because the reported size of a contained image is not properly checked for a BLP container, and thus an attempted memory allocation can be very large.

advisory.DiscoveredBy: Jiayi Lin, Luke Shaffer, Xinran Xie, Akshay Ajayan

notes.Note: mdeslaur> while this is mentioned in the 8.1.1 release notes, it doesn't seem to be mentioned in the CHANGES file, and I can't seem to locate the commits that fix this in 8.1.1 vs 8.1.0 This was actually fixed in 8.1.2.

criterions.comment: pillow: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
